enWisdom: Indeed the lone opinion [without any consultation] may be erroneous
At times [relying on] the intellect alone may lead [one] astray
One who acts against [good] advice gets perplexed
One who is opinionated [and headstrong] slips

Wisdom: مَنْ جَهِلَ وُجُوهَ الْآرَاءِ أَعْيَتْهُ الْحِيَلُ
enWisdom: One who is ignorant of the different opinions is incapacitated by ruses [and is unable to decide on the correct course]
One who admires his [own] opinion becomes abased (or goes astray)

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَبِدَّ بِرَأْيِكَ فَمَنِ اسْتَبَدَّ بِرَأْيِهِ هَلَكَ
enWisdom: Do not become opinionated [and headstrong], for the one who is opinionated is destroyed
